actions.description: In humanoid form, the werebat makes two scimitar attacks or two shortbow attacks. In hybrid form, it can make one bite attack and one scimitar attack.
actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)

actions.description: 5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the werebat gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebat lycanthropy.
actions.name: Bite (Bat or Hybrid Form Only)

actions.description: 5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.
actions.name: Scimitar (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)

actions.description: 5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.
actions.name: Shortbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)

damageImmunities: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
name: Werebat

specialTraits.description: The werebat can use its action to polymorph into a Medium bat-humanoid hybrid, or into a Large giant bat, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
specialTraits.name: Shapechanger

specialTraits.description: The werebat has blindsight out to a range of 60 feet as long as it's not deafened.
specialTraits.name: Echolocation (Bat or Hybrid Form Only)

specialTraits.description: The werebat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.
specialTraits.name: Keen Hearing

specialTraits.description: The werebat can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.
specialTraits.name: Nimble Escape (Humanoid Form Only)

specialTraits.description: While in sunlight, the werebat has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
specialTraits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
